thread.title: Pacers hold on to Paul George, fail to add veteran help
thread.title_full: Pacers hold on to Paul George, fail to add veteran help

author: nate.taylor@indystar.com
title: Pacers hold on to Paul George, fail to add veteran help
text:
Pacers hold on to Paul George, fail to add veteran help Nate Taylor , nate.taylor@indystar.com Published 3:21 p.m. ET Feb. 23, 2017 | Updated 41 minutes ago CLOSE x Share Indiana Pacers star Paul George sounds far less than happy with the team's approach to the NBA trade deadline. Clark Wade/IndyStar Paul George of Indiana, San Antonio Spurs at Indiana Pacers, Bankers Life Fieldhouse, Indianapolis, Monday, February 13, 2017. San Antonio won 110-106. (Photo: Robert Scheer/IndyStar) 182 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
INDIANAPOLIS — The Indiana Pacers, after showing urgency to make a move to improve their roster, were unable to complete a deal Thursday before the NBA’s trade deadline. 
The Pacers will now have to improve their 29-28 record in the Eastern Conference and solidify their spot in the playoffs with the roster team president Larry Bird put together last summer. 
The Pacers, according to multiple league sources, were hoping to make a non-blockbuster trade to bring in a veteran rotational player to help Paul George, Jeff Teague and Myles Turner in the second half of the season, which begins Friday against the Memphis Grizzlies. 
The best asset Bird was willing to trade was the Pacers’ first round pick in June’s draft. Yet the Pacers could not persuade another team to exchange a valuable player to boost their roster by surrendering their best draft pick. 
Much of the Pacers’ conversations with teams were overshadowed by the possibility of the Boston Celtics acquiring George. For much of the past two days, the Celtics engaged in talks with the Pacers to see what it would take for Bird to trade George. Ultimately, Bird decided to not deal George with the hope the franchise can convince their star player to re-sign with team after his expected opt-out at the end of the 2017-18 season.
